abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Phase of the
            Second and Third Program for Communes Facing Extreme
            Hardship in Ethnic Minority and Mountainous Areas (Program
            135) Project for Vietnam were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory; risk to development outcome was
            substantial; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory
            and borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: for the Development Policy
            Credits (DPCs) in support of decentralization reforms,
            active engagement with both national and sub-national
            leadership and levels of government is essential to build
            consensus and gain backing for the intended decentralization
            reforms. Promoting policy reforms for poverty reduction
            requires a multiple and coordinated engagement with the
            Government. Successful gender mainstreaming requires strong
            awareness raising and endorsement at all levels from policy
            makers to implementing agencies and local authorities.
            Program design should be flexible enough to allow for
            adjustments in poverty targeting over time. Policy
            interventions promoting innovative approaches to improving
            livelihoods are likely to be more successful if they
            directly address the core business and quality of
            agricultural sector services. Systematic and effective
            impact evaluation arrangements can greatly enhance learning.
